greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (f(-x^2) / phi(-x^3))^2 in powers of x where phi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Cubic AGM theta functions: a(q) (see A004016), b(q) (A005928), c(q) (A005882).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-2/3) * b(q^2) * c(q^2) / (3 * f(-q^3)^4) in powers of q where b(), c() are cubic AGM theta functions.
Expansion of q^(-1/6) * (eta(q^2) * eta(q^6) / eta(q^3)^2)^2 in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ x^2] QPochhammer[ x^6] / QPochhammer[ x^3]^2)^2, {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^6 + A) / eta(x^3 + A)^2)^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Dec 03 2013
